intro: Chorizema manglesii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring thick, fleshy leaves that help store water. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access moisture from underground water sources. Chorizema manglesii plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
